policy_details: CalTech has adopted a two-year Test Blind policy meaning it will not consider standardized test scores beginning with the 2020-21 admissions cycle. It will not consider the optional SAT Essay or ACT Writing Test or SAT Subject Test scores. CalTech does not offer merit-based aid.

The UC system has adopted a two-year test optional policy for first-year applicants both domestic and international beginning in the 2020-21 admission cycle. After those two years the UCs will be Test Blind (meaning they will not consider test scores) for two more years. At the end of the four year period they will consider whether to reinstate the testing requirement.
USC has adopted a one-year test optional policy for first-year applicants both domestic and international in the 2020-21 admission cycle.
Cal has adopted a four-year test blind policy beginning in the 2020-21 admission cycle. At the end of the four year period they will consider whether to reinstate the testing requirement.
UCI has adopted a four-year test blind policy beginning in the 2020-21 admission cycle. At the end of the four year period they will consider whether to reinstate the testing requirement.
